intro: Anplectrella, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland areas and thrives in partial shade. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anplectrella has smooth, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that ripen to a dark purple color.
